titles.title: Supporting the goals of Motorcycle Safety Awareness Month.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Highways and Transit.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Subcommittee on Highways and Transit Discharged.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 110-655.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 221.

action.text: Ms. Hirono moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 339.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Petri objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR 5/19/2008 H4100-4101)

bill.summary: 5/21/2008--Passed House amended. (This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the House on May 19, 2008. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Supports the goals of Motorcycle Safety Awareness Month. Encourages all road users to be more aware of motorcycles and motorcyclists' safety. Encourages all motorcycle riders receive appropriate training and practice safe riding skills.
